definition: deep suffering can lead to enlightenment (idiom)/storms make oaks take deeper root
surname Yin/dynasty name at the end the Shang dynasty, after their move to Yinxu 殷墟 in modern Henan province
to worry/to concern oneself with/worried/anxiety/sorrow/(literary) to observe mourning
to open/to start/to initiate/to enlighten or awaken/to state/to inform

much hardships may awaken a nation (idiom); calamity that prompts renewal
don't forget past events, they can guide you in future (idiom); benefit from past experience

definition: national humiliation, refers to Japanese incursions into China in the 1930s and 40s, and more especially to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria

to bring honor to one's ancestors and benefit future generations (idiom)
to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
to pay careful attention to one's parents' funerary rites
